com.yuti.regionbgm.client.handlers

Class ClientHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yuti.regionbgm.client.handlers.ClientHandler

  • public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to handle client-side events of the mod.

      static void cancelMinecraftMusic(net.minecraftforge.fml.common.gameevent.TickEvent.PlayerTickEvent event)
      Stop minecraft's music if the action as been requested (see onMinecraftMusicStarts(PlaySoundEvent))

      Handles configuration update.

      Stops the BGM when the player leave the server (or the singleplayer world)

      Updates mod's volume if Minecraft's master volume is updated.
      static void onMinecraftMusicStarts(net.minecraftforge.client.event.sound.PlaySoundEvent event)
      Detects when a Minecraft's music is playing in order to stopping it if the mod's music player is currently playing a music.

        public static void onLeaveServer(net.minecraftforge.fml.common.network.FMLNetworkEvent.ClientDisconnectionFromServerEvent event)
        Stops the BGM when the player leave the server (or the singleplayer world)
        Parameters:

      • onConfigUpdate

        public static void onConfigUpdate(net.minecraftforge.fml.client.event.ConfigChangedEvent.PostConfigChangedEvent event)
        Handles configuration update. It will update the volume set in the configuration. If the player disable the mod, it will stop the music, if it's reactivated, it will ask for a refresh on server-side.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • onMasterVolumeUpdated

        public static void onMasterVolumeUpdated(net.minecraftforge.client.event.GuiScreenEvent.MouseInputEvent.Post event)
        Updates mod's volume if Minecraft's master volume is updated.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • onMinecraftMusicStarts

        public static void onMinecraftMusicStarts(net.minecraftforge.client.event.sound.PlaySoundEvent event)
        Detects when a Minecraft's music is playing in order to stopping it if the mod's music player is currently playing a music. The music can't be stopped here because it's not loaded into the miencraft's sound engine yet. That's why the action needs to be delayed.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • cancelMinecraftMusic

        public static void cancelMinecraftMusic(net.minecraftforge.fml.common.gameevent.TickEvent.PlayerTickEvent event)
        Stop minecraft's music if the action as been requested (see onMinecraftMusicStarts(PlaySoundEvent))
        Parameters:
        event -
